original_title: Sri Lanka rupee at 329.25/95 to spot-next dollar, bond yields edge lower
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka rupee was quoted at 329.25/95 in the spot-next market, marginally stronger from yesterday’s close dealers said as bond yields continued to fall.The spot next dollar (spot plus one day settlement) closed at  330.00/331.00 to the US dollar Tuesday.

The rupee has weakened sharply with one-sided interventions to prevent appreciation and flip of the regime to float under as soon as there is a little demand, killing confidence in the market, even when open market operations was deflationary earlier in the year.

A central bank that does not print money to enforce rate cuts (avoids inflationary open market operations) can control an exchange rate at will through a consistent peg. Banks now are collecting dollars to square their open positions ahead of a bond exchange, which requires higher interest rates to curtail domestic credit.
Analysts have warned the central bank not to conduct complex open market operations and encourage banks and primary dealers to buy Treasuries with window money.
A bond maturing on 15.05.2030 was quoted at 14.35/45 percent down from Tuesday’s close at 14.45/60 percent.
A bond maturing on 01.05.2028 was quoted at 14.70/75 percent down from yesterday’s at 14.78/88 percent
A bond maturing on 15.09.2027 was quoted at 15.25/35 percent down from yesterday’s close at 15.30/35 percent.
A bond maturing on 15.05.2026 was quoted at 15.25/35 percent down from yesterday’s close at 15.32/38 percent.
A bond maturing on 01.07.2025 was quoted at 15.70/90 percent down from yesterday’s close at 15.80/16.00 percent.(Colombo/July25/2023)
